title: How to Make Banana Peel Tea

steps.title: Freeze the banana peels.
steps.content: Freeze the banana peels. As you eat bananas, peel off labels. Throw peels into your freezer.

steps.title: Thaw the banana peels.
steps.content: Thaw the banana peels. Fill a pan when you have enough peels. Let them thaw in your pan for an hour or two. They should turn black.

steps.title: Pasteurize the thawed peels.
steps.content: Pasteurize the thawed peels. Put the peels in an oven at pasteurization temperature (~65C/150ÂºF). Bake until dry. This should take less than one hour.

steps.title: Crack and shred your peels by hand just a bit.
steps.content: Crack and shred your peels by hand just a bit.

steps.title: Pulverize one peel at a time in the blender, adding up to four peels before emptying your blender.
steps.content: Pulverize one peel at a time in the blender, adding up to four peels before emptying your blender.

steps.title: Store in a closed container in a cool, dark place.
steps.content: Store in a closed container in a cool, dark place. Glass jars (with or without gasket seals) are an excellent choice.

steps.title: Pour hot water over one heaping teaspoon of the blended peel.
steps.content: Pour hot water over one heaping teaspoon of the blended peel. That is about as strong as a black tea bag. Always adjust amounts to your taste.

steps.title: Strain through a fine-mesh coffee strainer.
steps.content: Strain through a fine-mesh coffee strainer. The strainer can be lined with a paper coffee filter as well. Alternatively, put the pulverized peels in a tea bomb, then submerge the bomb in hot water and let steep for a short while.

steps.title: Enjoy before bedtime, to help send you into a good night's sleep.
steps.content: Enjoy before bedtime, to help send you into a good night's sleep.
